title: Love Island mercilessly mocked by Phoebe Waller-Bridge on Saturday Night Live
text:
You know you’re an international phenomenon when SNL mocks the living hell out of you – so congratulations Love Island, you’ve officially made it.

Phoebe Waller-Bridge led the cast for the weekly satirical look at the world, with Phoebe taking on the lip-filler loving Bella-Rosa whose dad’s a builder and mum’s a pub.

She’s soon coupling up with Finlay, a man who’s ‘just looking for the right woman to cheat on for the rest of his life’.

Look familiar….? (Picture: NBC)

(Anyone else getting Anna and Jordan kinda vibes from these two?!)

Meanwhile, Aidy Bryant appears to be channelling her inner Gemma Collins if anyone, wiping off her make-up to reveal she looks like a thumb.

‘You will watch 50 hours of this…you think you won’t but you will,’ the fake ad states – which is definitely a vibe we can get behind.

Then there’s those super awkward late night moments where the other islanders have to endure beds creaking and duvet covers doing little to hide anything.

Phoebe went all in on the Love Island send up (Picture: NBC)

Unfortunately for Bella-Rosa, she is soon dumped from the island…but her sorrow doesn’t last too long as she discovers she’s now got 1.2million Instagram followers.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Well I don’t have to be a stupid paediatric nurse anymore do I?! Kerching!,’ she praises.

More: Love Island Love Island's Tommy Fury branded a 'diva' by furious fans after cancelling club appearance Love Island's Amy Hart sports floral pink ensemble at Meggan Grubb's In The Style party Love Island's Camilla Thurlow's anxiety became so bad she considered taking her own life

The accuracy is a little scary.

Fleabag star Phoebe made her hosting debut on SNL and had Taylor Swift as her musical guest, ensuring it was a girl power kind of evening.

Saturday Night Live airs on NBC in the US, and is available internationally on YouTube.

description: Phoebe Waller-Bridge made her hosting debut on SNL this week and Love Island was among her targets in sketches for the show.
